page.title: 10CHURCH IN BISHOPS FROME
page.content: Bishops Frome Parish Church, dedicated to St. Mary the Virgin, can be traced back to 12th century. The architecture is Transitional (Norman and early English). Built mainly of local sandstone rubble with dressings, and with tiled roof, it comprises a Chancel, Lady Chapel on the north side, Western Tower and South Porch. Set is a well tended churchyard of some 2 acres, the church stands above the surrounding area, and to the east the glebe-land stretches down to the River Frome. The 56ft west tower, dated about 1340, with walls 4ft thick, contains a ring of six bells and a sanctus bell. These were installed in 1975 to replace the originals. The church is one of five served by Rev. George Talbot who lives in the modern rectory. Each sunday at 10am, a Holy Communion Service is held
